Method Detail

checkClassResourceAsStreamExists

@FullyTested
public static InputStream checkClassResourceAsStreamExists(Class<?> clazz,
                                                                       String pathname,
                                                                       String pathnameArgName)
                                                    throws ClassResourceNotFoundException
Tests if a resource exists via Class.getResourceAsStream(String). Resources are usually configuration files with text or binary data, embedded in a JAR file, and accessible with a UNIX/POSIX-like path.

For projects using Maven, resources are normally stored in two locations:

  • Class resources: src/main/resources
  • Test class resources: src/test/resources

Example: Internet proxy settings may be stored in a properties file. In the project, the properties file is saved to path "src/main/resources/proxy.properties". This file is then embedded as a resource in a JAR and accessible at path: "/proxy.properties"

Since Class.getResourceAsStream(String) is used to find the resource, the handling of relative and absolute paths is surprisingly different. (Absolute paths have a leading "/" character, and relative paths do not.) Relative paths have the class package name added as a prefix.

Example: For class foo.bar.Baz, relative resource path "data/xyz.txt" becomes absolute resource path "/foo/bar/data/xyz.txt"

Read more here about relative vs. absolute paths.

Parameters:
clazz - ref to class object to find resource
pathname - relative path (without leading "/") to resource, e.g., "proxy.properties",
or absolute path (with leading "/") to resource, e.g., "/proxy.properties"
pathnameArgName - argument name for pathname, e.g., "outputFile" or "inputFile"
Returns:
result from Class.getResourceAsStream(String)
Throws:
NullPointerException - if clazz or pathname is null
IllegalArgumentException - if pathname is empty
ClassResourceNotFoundException - if resource is not found

checkFileExists

@FullyTested
public static File checkFileExists(String pathname,
                                               String argName)
                            throws PathException
This is a convenience method for checkFileExists(File, String).

Throws:
NullPointerException - if pathname is null
IllegalArgumentException - if pathname is empty
PathException

checkFileExists

@FullyTested
public static File checkFileExists(File path,
                                               String argName)
                            throws PathException
Tests if a file exists at a path. Exception messages distinguish between paths that (a) do not exist, and (b) exist, but are not files.

Parameters:
path - path to check
argName - argument name for path, e.g., "outputFile" or "inputFile"
Returns:
validated path
Throws:
NullPointerException - if path is null
PathException -
  • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_DOES_NOT_EXIST if path does not exist
  • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_DIRECTORY if path exists, but is not a file
See Also:
checkFileExists(String, String), checkNotFile(File, String), checkDirectoryExists(File, String)

checkNotFile

@FullyTested
public static File checkNotFile(String pathname,
                                            String argName)
                         throws PathException
This is a convenience method for checkNotFile(File, String).

Throws:
NullPointerException - if pathname is null
IllegalArgumentException - if pathname is empty
PathException

checkNotFile

@FullyTested
public static File checkNotFile(File path,
                                            String argName)
                         throws PathException
Tests if a file does not exist at a path. In other words, the path must not exist,
or exists only as a directory. Understanding the purpose of this method is more subtle than its opposing relative, checkFileExists(File, String).

Example: Prior to creating a directory, check the path is not a file.

Parameters:
path - path to check
argName - argument name for path, e.g., "outputFile" or "inputFile"
Returns:
validated path
Throws:
NullPointerException - if path is null
PathException - with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_NORMAL_FILE if path exists and is a file
See Also:
checkNotFile(String, String), checkFileExists(File, String)

                                                    String argName)

checkDirectoryExists

@FullyTested
public static File checkDirectoryExists(File path,
                                                    String argName)
                                 throws PathException
Tests if a directory exists at a path. Exception messages distinguish between paths that (a) do not exist and (b) exist, but are not directories.

Parameters:
path - path to check
argName - argument name for path, e.g., "outputDir" or "inputDir"
Returns:
validated path
Throws:
NullPointerException - if path is null
PathException -
  • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_DOES_NOT_EXIST if path does not exist
  • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_NORMAL_FILE if path exists, but is not a directory
See Also:
checkDirectoryExists(String, String), checkNotDirectory(File, String), checkFileExists(File, String)

checkNotDirectory

@FullyTested
public static File checkNotDirectory(File path,
                                                 String argName)
                              throws PathException
Tests if a directory does not exist at a path. In other words, the path must not exist, or exists only as a file. Understanding the purpose of this method is more subtle than its opposing relative, checkDirectoryExists(File, String).

Example: Prior to writing a file, check the path is not a directory.

Parameters:
path - path to check
argName - argument name for path, e.g., "outputFile" or "inputFile"
Returns:
validated path
Throws:
NullPointerException - if path is null
PathException - with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_DIRECTORY if path is a directory
See Also:
checkNotDirectory(String, String), checkDirectoryExists(File, String)
